config.question: Which of the following incidents forced Tecumseh to seek British military assistance against the Americans?

choices.content: American attack on Shawnees at the Battle of Tippecanoe
French attack on Indian villages in Canada
American monopolization of the fur trade

answer_3.response: On November 7, 1811, the American troops routed the Indians at the Battle of Tippecanoe. This incident forced Tecumseh to seek British military assistance against the Americans, something he probably would not have done had Harrison left him alone.
